page.title: 14FARMING IN ARNPRIOR
page.content: There are 12 farms in the block, but no information could be obtained on 2 of these. Of the remainder, 4 are operated by owner farmers and 6 by tenants. 1 farmer owns his farm but also rents the adjacent lands. Each farm is typically worked by 3 people including the farmer - usually the others are sons or other relatives. One man, however, farms his 150 acre farm by himself. The 10 farms comprise of approximately 950 acres of arable land, 1400 acres of grazing pasture and 170 acres of woodland. The lands at the base of the valley have heavy clay soils typical of the Carse of Stirling. Further south the soil is medium loam.
